image.altText: two people face building with police tape

props.synopsis: A Queensland man who killed six people at a Sydney shopping centre had never been arrested or charged in his home state, police have confirmed.

title.children: Parents of Bondi Junction attacker sent message of support to officer who shot him, police say

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Chris Minns carrying flowers surrounded by crowds

props.synopsis: Assistant Commissioner Anthony Cooke says the attacker was 40-year-old Queensland man Joel Cauchi, who suffered from "mental health issues". Follow live.

title.children: Public tributes to Bondi Junction stabbing victims grow as police identify attacker

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: More victims of Bondi Junction attack identified
Use 'discretion' with social media, Minns says
WATCH: Queensland Police provide update on Bondi Junction attack

image.altText: Police tape wrapped around a metal pole.

props.synopsis: Authorities formally identify Joel Cauchi as the 40-year-old man shot by police after he fatally stabbed five women and one man at Westfield Bondi Junction on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Details of police investigation into shopping centre attack emerge as tributes paid to victims and responders

image.altText: A composite picture of Faraz Tahir and Ashlee Good

props.synopsis: Six people, including five women, have been confirmed dead after a stabbing attack in a busy Sydney shopping centre on Saturday. Here's what we know about those who died.

title.children: Who are the victims of the Bondi Junction stabbing attack?

image.altText: Iranians celebrate on a street, after the IRGC attack on Israel.

props.synopsis: Iran launches hundreds of drones and ballistic missiles toward Israel in a move many fear will push the Middle East closer to a region-wide war.

title.children: Booms and sirens in Israel after Iran launches 200 missiles and drones in unprecedented attack

image.altText: Api Koroisau takes a photo with a Wests Tigers fan at Leichhardt Oval.

props.synopsis: The Wests Tigers are playing in front of a full house at Campbelltown for the first time since 2005 as they host the St George Illawarra Dragons. Follow live.

title.children: Benji effect in full swing as Tigers have first sell-out since premiership season

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: It's a sell-out in Campbelltown for the first time since the premiership season

image.altText: A composite image of AFL players Harley Reid and Dustin Martin in action

props.synopsis: A possible match-up in the midfield between number one draft pick Harley Reid and three-time premiership champion Dustin Martin headlines the final match of round five. Follow live.

title.children: Focus turns to Perth as Harley and Dusty match-up highlights end to round five

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Cats remain unbeaten after huge win over Kangaroos

image.altText: A man at the top of an escalator holds a bollard, to holds back a man with a knife

props.synopsis: In the aftermath of the tragedy at Westfield Bondi Junction, stories have emerged of a man holding back the knife-wielding attacker with a bollard and shop attendants guiding customers to safety in the back rooms of stores.

title.children: Bystanders praised for heroic acts during Bondi stabbing attacks

image.altText: A man confronts another man who holds a knife in a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: Police have identified the man behind the deadly attack at Westfield Bondi Junction that left six people dead. Multiple victims are currently in hospital.

title.children: What we know about how the Bondi Junction stabbing attack unfolded

image.altText: westfield bondi sign with ambulances in front of building

props.synopsis: A senior police officer who acted alone to halt a stabbing rampage at a Bondi Junction shopping centre on Saturday is being lauded for her life-saving bravery.

title.children: 'Enormous courage': Lone officer saved lives by confronting and shooting Bondi Junction attacker

image.altText: Stacy Patterson wears a dark red blouse.

props.synopsis: Stacy Patterson was in her late 20s and training to be a surgeon when she developed a tremor. While a Parkinson's diagnosis ended that dream, she's found new passions to get excited about.

title.children: How a doctor's hand tremor led to a whole new career path

image.altText: A collage of different AI models forming a woman. The is code and photoshop tool motifs throughout.

props.synopsis: ABC Investigations has uncovered how an international network of so-called "AI Pimps" are mass-harvesting women's social media videos to peddle porn through fake influencers.

title.children: Jordan's Anatomy: How an Australian pornographer built his AI superstar

image.altText: Woman with black hair and pink blouse wears a name badge and smiles brightly in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Brawls and violence were part of life at Cessnock High. Now it's a model for best practice.

title.children: Treating students as 'our own kids': How teachers like Kelsey transformed this 'violent' high school

image.altText: A young girl's hand over an elderly man's hand sitting on the arm of a chair.

props.synopsis: From helplines to hiring someone to do their paperwork, many of our seniors could use a hand dealing with an increasingly complex aged care system. It "takes a village" to help them too, say advocates, and this is where to start.

title.children: More older Australians are left to navigate aging alone. Here's what help is available

image.altText: Bluey The Sign

props.synopsis: The 28-minute episode doesn't disappoint with a special wedding and an answer to whether the Heelers sell up and move. But look a little closer and The Sign is full of other hidden treats too. Here's nine you might've missed. Spoilers ahead.

title.children: Bluey's longest-ever episode is here and so are a stack of Easter eggs

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men. They are swabbing the mouth of a duck while the other man holds it still

props.synopsis: Professor Graeme Laver was behind a major influenza discovery in the 1970s when he began testing birds on Tryon Island for the flu. His research led to the development of drugs like Tamiflu.

title.children: How an 'unlikely place to look for flu' on the Great Barrier Reef led to major influenza discoveries

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt and jacket holds an umbrella while walking next to a woman wearing a pink jacket and jeans.

props.synopsis: Harvey Moeis's life was idyllic to the point where he was dubbed "the perfect husband" by online users in Indonesia. But that all came crashing down in early April when Indonesian police arrested him and placed him under arrest over a corruption scandal.

title.children: He was the 'perfect husband' to a famous Indonesian model. Then came a shocking arrest

image.altText: A close up of Zendaya against an orange backdrop wearing a metallic silver robot suit

props.synopsis: Whether it's Margot Robbie dressed in head-to-toe pink for Barbie, or Zendaya wearing a robot suit at the premiere of Dune's sequel, celebrities are using fashion to take their storytelling beyond the screen.

title.children: From Zendaya to Margot Robbie, 'method dressing' is Hollywood's latest obsession

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Still talking a big game when it comes to online quizzes? Let's put that confidence to the test.

title.children: Feeling confident in your quiz ability? Let's fix that. It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: Bearded man smiles as an Indian bearded man holds his hand on his head. Both wear orange, drapped clothing

props.synopsis: Barrister, flower farmer, truck driver and life saver. This is how Arnold Dix became the "international man of mystery" who helped save 41 men from a collapsed tunnel.

title.children: Arnold Dix was pivotal in rescuing 41 men from an underground tomb. But he didn't charge a cent for his work

image.altText: A young woman in a black shirt in front of plants.

props.synopsis: About one in three Australians report being lonely but talking about it can be hard. To help, clubs and events and have emerged to help people make forge new friendships.

title.children: 'Just here, hanging out with my mum': After falling out with a mate, Arran struggled to make new friends

image.altText: A group of shipping containers in a paddock

props.synopsis: Investigations are continuing into the discovery of two bodies in a shipping container in the NSW Central West town of Gulgong.

title.children: Decomposing bodies discovered in shipping container shocks community

image.altText: Clare O'Neil stands alongside Andrew Giles at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: A minor High Court correction to a landmark ruling embodies how the recent NZYQ saga has up-ended Australia's immigration detention system and shaken its political and legal institutions.

title.children: The quiet message from the High Court that embodies the saga that's followed a landmark ruling

image.altText: A group of Wrexham footballers in red shirts stand together cheering with arms raised in triumph.

props.synopsis: The most famous Welsh football club in the world is celebrating again, as Wrexham — co-owned by Hollywood stars Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney — clinches promotion for the second season in a row, to be two divisions away from the Premier League.

title.children: Ryan Reynolds celebrates 'ride of our lives' as Wrexham gains back-to-back promotions

props.synopsis: From laps in outback water holes to Sydney's stadium of Olympic dreams, a tiny NSW primary school defies the odds and raises the roof in the state championships relay race.

title.children: This school only has five students, but four of them made it to the state swimming championships

image.altText: A man giving a dodgy look to the camera

props.synopsis: Solomon Islands heads to the polls on Wednesday in what experts are calling the most important election in its history. Will the "master of mayhem" get a record fifth term?

title.children: He's been called a 'budding dictator' on Australia's doorstep — with China's help, is that what he wants?

image.altText: Jack Nicholson and Diane Keaton walk along a beach, dressed all in white, in scene from Something's Gotta Give.

props.synopsis: There's plenty to be nostalgic about as the Nancy Meyers' film marks two decades since its release — but when it comes to inequity in age-gap relationships has anything really changed?

title.children: Something's Gotta Give scrutinised older bachelors serial-dating young women. That was 20 years ago, and it's still happening

image.altText: A man and his daughter stand leaning on a farm buggie with their black and white working dogs in the back.

props.synopsis: Being paid to get rid of weeds sounds like a farmer's ultimate dream, and it may just become reality for a group of graziers in rural Australia.

title.children: How problem weeds could power up a former coal generator

image.altText: Dan Fischer stands outside in front of some trees with a swag.

props.synopsis: In the Northern Territory, where homelessness and housing overcrowding is the worst in the nation, one man's swag-making program is starting to make a difference.

title.children: Once a 'serial runaway', Dan is teaching people the 'dying trade' of swag-making

image.altText: A home-cooked chicken pie being served onto two plates with a knife and serving spoon

props.synopsis: Made with leeks, carrots, turnips and peas, it’s creamy and buttery and just the ticket on a cool night, whether you’re craving comfort yourself or wish to serve some up to friends and family.

title.children: This chicken pot pie is the perfect meal for a cosy evening in

image.altText: A man holding a handful of dried hemp.

props.synopsis: Neil Preston decided to hand build his four-bedroom home from "hempcrete" after learning it would be hypoallergenic, sound insulating and cosy all year round.

title.children: Ten thousand kilograms of hemp won't get you high like marijuana, but it can help you build a home
